book.title: Statistics with Python: 100 Solved Exercises for Data Analysis
book.author: Parsed by LEO AI

sections.summary:
Probability is the measure of the likelihood that an event will occur,
ranging from 0 to 1.
content:
Probability is the measure of the likelihood that an event will occur,
ranging from 0 to 1.
A random experiment is a process with an uncertain outcome.
The set of all possible outcomes is called the **Sample Space (S)**.
An **Event (E)** is a subset of the sample space.

sections.summary: An event is a collection of outcomes from a random experiment.
content: An event is a collection of outcomes from a random experiment.
The **union** of two events represents outcomes belonging to either event.
The **intersection** represents outcomes common to both events.
The **complement** of an event includes all outcomes not in the event.

sections.summary: Descriptive statistics summarize and describe the main features of a dataset.
content: Descriptive statistics summarize and describe the main features of a dataset.
The **mean** is the arithmetic average of all observations.
The **median** is the middle value when the data is ordered.
The median is less sensitive to outliers than the mean.
